description: Dive into "Shopping Adventures in Ipoh's Malls" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Shopping Adventures in Ipoh's Malls

places.generalDescription: Ipoh Parade is a modern landmark in the historic city, offering a comprehensive retail destination for both locals and visitors. The shopping center houses a variety of exclusive brands in Perak, making it an excellent shopping hub filled with retail options, entertainment, and diverse dining choices catering to the community's demographics. Connected to Weil Hotel, it forms a large shopping complex providing entertainment, retail therapy, and dining options for everyone.

sources.snippet: To know: This wonderful mall is one of the best Ipoh shopping malls!. There are several shops that you will enjoy going here and there shopping from, and it will be a wonderful moment you can live with your close ones!. To do: You will find its many sections that are brimming with a variety of great clothing stores and shoe stores, and additionally, there‚Äôs also a supermarket that grants you the possibility to buy all of your daily requirements.

#celebratewithtrip Ever since Ipoh Parade completed its renovation works in 2014, it has reclaimed the hearts of the Ipoh populace and its position as a premium shopping centre for locals and tourists alike. It is located at 105, Jalan Sultan Abdul Jalil, Pusat Perdagangan Greentown, 30450 Ipoh, it is open daily from 1000-2200. The largest mall of its kind in the historic town of Ipoh.
sources.shortName: Largest Mall in Ipoh | Trip.com Ipoh

sources.snippet: Guests staying at  WEIL hotel have direct access to Parkson Ipoh Parade Mall through the ground floor of the mall and the hotel lobby. The walkway between them leads to the eateries inside the mall. Locals typically come to Ipoh Parade for the GSC cinema, cheap fashion, bowling, and the fancy basement supermarket with imported goods (Jaya Grocer)!
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls In Ipoh ‚Äì Where To Go To Escape A Rainy Day

sources.snippet: Other popular malls in Ipoh are Kinta City Shopping Centre and Ipoh Parade; both offer enough shops, restaurants, amusement centers and cinemas for a fun day out. We know people that travel from Ipoh to Kuala Lumpur for some serious shopping; and we often hear people from Ipoh complain that their city has a major shortage of good shopping malls.
sources.shortName: Places To Visit in Malaysia - Ipoh Perak

sources.snippet: Parking is indoors and this mall is interconnected to WEIL Hotel. It‚Äôs got a high-end supermarket in the basement, Jaya Grocer and a large hardware store, ACE Hardware. Both tenants feature a lot of imported products.
sources.shortName: Which Shopping Malls To Visit In Ipoh

places.name: Ipoh Parade

reviews.text:
Ipoh Parade is a vibrant shopping destination that stands out as one of the most popular malls in Ipoh. Its modern design and variety of retail, dining, and entertainment options make it a favorite among locals and visitors alike.

Shopping Experience: The mall boasts a wide range of shops, from high-end international brands to local boutiques, ensuring that shoppers of all preferences can find something to love. Whether you're looking for fashion, electronics, or unique gifts, Ipoh Parade has it all.

Dining Choices: Food lovers are spoiled for choice with its extensive selection of eateries. From popular fast-food chains to cozy cafes and diverse restaurants offering local and international cuisines, there's something to satisfy every craving.

Entertainment: Ipoh Parade goes beyond shopping with its impressive entertainment facilities. The moviegoers will appreciate the state-of-the-art cinema, while families and kids can enjoy the indoor playgrounds and gaming arcades. Seasonal events and promotions often add to the fun, keeping the mall lively throughout the year.

Convenience: The mall's ample parking, strategic location in the heart of Ipoh, and accessibility make it a hassle-free place to visit. It also features clean, well-maintained facilities, which enhance the overall experience.

Ipoh Parade combines shopping, dining, and entertainment seamlessly, offering a one-stop destination for leisure and enjoyment. Whether you're spending the day with family, meeting friends, or simply indulging in some retail therapy, Ipoh Parade never disappoints!

A signature shopping mall for Ipoh Local. Every seasonal festival, sure will visit here as different decorations are presented. Sometimes it is impressive, sometimes it is common.

A place of shopping, food and beverage, cinema, bookstore, clothing, etc can be found here.

"Ipoh Parade is a convenient and vibrant mall in the heart of the city, offering a good mix of retail shops, dining options, and entertainment like a cinema and bowling alley. It's spacious, well-maintained, and perfect for families or a casual day out. Great spot for both shopping and relaxing indoors in Ipoh."

places.address: 105, Jalan Sultan Abdul Jalil, Pusat Perdagangan Greentown, 30450 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: AEON Kinta City is a popular shopping destination in Ipoh, offering a fantastic vibe and a classy food court. The mall hosts famous fashion labels and provides all the basic items one might need. With ground floor parking for easy access, it spans three floors and features stores like Aeon supermarket, Tealive, llaollao, Kenny Rogers, Sushi King, and more. The supermarket within the mall offers a wide variety of items but may have slow customer service at checkout counters.

sources.snippet: While small enough to explore in a few hours, its central location is the reason it‚Äôs so popular. On weekends, the car park (both indoor and outdoor) is overflowing. Anchor tenants are AEON department store and supermarket.
sources.shortName: Which Shopping Malls To Visit In Ipoh

sources.snippet: This is Ipoh‚Äôs  most popular mall as it enjoys a central location and is the very first Aeon in Ipoh. And for a long time, it was the only one. If a local mentions Jusco, they are likely referring to this mall.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls In Ipoh ‚Äì Where To Go To Escape A Rainy Day

places.name: AEON Mall Kinta City

reviews.text:
Among the TOP 3 Shopping Mall in Ipoh. Almost everything under 1 roof.
Great place to spend a day with family, friends, or colleagues.
Shops like pharmacy, restaurants, cinema, ice cream shop, AEON groceries and departmental store, pet shop, etc.
Smaller than the Ipoh Parade mall, but modern type. We have our fried noodles lunch there at one seasfood restaurant in this mall. Not expensive and delicious.

Produces are so fresh ! This Aeon Kinta in Ipoh is fully replenished with everything you need. From groceries, large varieties of fruits from all over the countries, juices, large varieties of sauces, seafood selections, meat, home cares, toiletries, clothing, even liquor. One stop for all you need. It's clean and spacious

places.address: 2, Jalan Teh Lean Swee, Taman Ipoh Selatan, 31400 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

sources.snippet: To know: Make sure to check out Mydin Mall Meru Raya which is the best mall in Ipoh where you will amazed by the various choices you will be able to make!. To do: There‚Äôs no question about it, you really need to experience this amazing mall where you‚Äôll be able to find a collection of nice clothing stores and shoe stores as well as a supermarket where you‚Äôll get to buy your daily groceries. And in case you want to unwind a little in this mall, which is considered one of the best Ipoh shopping centers, we invite you to get a meal at Subway or have your preferred beverages at Tea Amo Cafe.

Mydin is a Malaysian chain of hypermarkets, supermarkets, and emporiums. The Mydin Mall over at Meru is walking distance from the Amanjaya bus terminal (Terminal Amanjaya). The mall is a bit shabby in places (especially the toilets), but you can buy a lot of things (notably cheaper groceries in bulk) here while your kids hang out at the playing zone.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls In Ipoh ‚Äì Where To Go To Escape A Rainy Day

places.name: Mydin Mall Meru Raya

reviews.text: I went here to buy repair tools like hammers, screwdrivers, and nails at a hardware store (Mr. DIY). There is also a food court located at the ground floor typically visited by travellers on the way to the adjacent bus terminal.

The place is crowded with Malay. Some of the items prices are cheaper compared to other hypermarkets, especially the clothing item. some of the items are sold at a wholesaler price such as snack food, coffee, soft drink.

Malay traditional cloth for male and female can be found here. Nice and friendly price.

Sunday | 29/10/2023
The mall is surprisingly big and spacious located near Terminal Amanjaya, Ipoh. There are a lot of parking spaces so for the most part you don't have to worry about finding a suitable parking space for your vehicle. In front of the mall near the entrance into the mall, you can find a lot of eateries offering different types of food and drinks.There are several fast food chains inside the mall such as Marrybrown, Subway, and Big Apple Donuts & Coffee. The mall is clean and tidy for the most part except there are a lot of vendors selling food products and clothes inside the mall so it could be overwhelming for those who don't like to be around a lot of stuff and things like that. One big thing that I noticed is that the mall is not as cold or frigid as others such as Lotus or Aeon so I don't know what's up with the air conditioning system inside the mall. The escalators are poorly maintained and they are making weird noises as you ride them. I have to give credits to the products that the mall is offering. There are a lot of Malaysian made products as well as international products inside the mall. The products that are being offered ranging from plastic products, canned foods, confectioneries, soft drinks to undergarments, shoes, personal care products and wooden furnitures. The prices are quite reasonable but some products could be a whole lot more expensive than others so make sure you know what you are buying. Best to go for all the discounted products for more bang for your buck but just watch out for the expiry date because those discounted products could reach their expiry date in a few months to come or more but not all. You can see the price tags being displayed on the racks and compare the prices yourself. Overall a great experience for me shopping at the mall with my family. Definitely will visit again in the future if I had a chance. I guess that's all that I want to say. üëçüëçüëçüá≤üáæüá≤üáæüá≤üáæ

places.address: PT Lot 03, Jalan Meru Bestari B2, Bandar Meru Raya, 30020 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

sources.snippet: To know: Lotus‚Äôs Ipoh Garden Mall is the best shopping center in Ipoh!. There are many stores that you will enjoy going here and there shopping from, and it will be a marvelous moment you can share with your loved ones!. To do: You can find a number of excellent clothing stores and shoe stores alongside a supermarket that contains all of your daily needs.

places.name: Lotus's Ipoh Garden

reviews.text:
Trolley situation much better with new units. Paid parking now BUT 2 hours free. Reasonable.
Price in Lotus very good. Other shops like Sports Direct and Watson.

Posted 14th July 2024
A mid-size outlet, clean and tidy. Well stocked. Located on the first floor. Not crowded early morning. Ample free parking space available, covered and uncovered.

I had a poor experience at Lotus supermarket. There were no trolleys available at the usual trolley bay, which caused visitors to go up and down between the ground floor and 1st floor, walking a long way just to look for one.

Later I asked the staff and found out that all the remaining trolleys were placed at Shopping Lane 2, which is not the proper place to keep them. This is very inconvenient for customers.

I hope management can improve the trolley arrangement so shoppers can easily find them at the designated trolley areas.

places.address: 2, Jln Jambu, Taman Ipoh Timur, 31400 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

sources.snippet: To know: You‚Äôre going on a shopping journey in Ipoh‚Äôs malls, aren‚Äôt you?. We will be mentioning the best shopping mall in Ipoh. It is AEON Mall Klebang, and you will be happy with the given services that will make you feel comfortable while shopping with your close ones.

reviews.text: It's another excellent Mall of Aeon. This is near Klebang, alot of residential areas and a also some factories in the Kinta Free Trade Zone. As usual, reasonable number of parking with cover. Generally all the major brands and franchises can be found here. The cinema operator here is TGV
Very nice and quite a lot of option shops here eventho a bit sunyi. Loving the event area looks in the market cuz looks full and nice display when i enter

Posted 9th May 2024
The mall is fairly big with quite a number of notable outlets as well as a cinema.
The main outlet is Aeon supermarket and department store. It is clean, tidy, and well stocked of normal items as well as some premium imported items. There is a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables produce. With the freshness, the prices are a bit on the premium side.
Prices of dry food and household items are also on the premium side unless there is a promotion.
The department store items are mostly apparel, footwear, and household items.
Staff is okay and helpful.
The mall is clean and well maintained.
Parking is cashless. There is ample parking in the mall either outdoors or indoors, which is located above the ground level.

places.generalDescription: AEON Mall Ipoh Station 18 is a top shopping destination in Ipoh, offering a wide array of fashion and shoe stores, as well as a supermarket catering to daily needs. Situated in the Pasir Puteh 18 area, it is one of the oldest AEON malls in Ipoh and boasts nearby amenities like Tesco/Lotus and McDonald's. With its three-floor mall directory, this popular shopping center provides an extensive selection for visitors.

sources.snippet: To know: When you want to go to the best shopping malls in Ipoh, we are here to guide you!. Indeed, AEON Mall Ipoh Station 18 is considered the best shopping center in Ipoh that you will deeply love for the endless choices it grants!. To do: It is possible to get a collection of different fashions clothing stores and shoe stores alongside a supermarket that possesses all of your daily requirements.

Anchor tenants at this mall are AEON department store and supermarket. Most notably, this mall features a lot of local fashion brands, and big fashion retail names like Cotton On, H&M, flipper, FOSSIL, LEVI‚ÄôS, and UNIQLO. As for dining options, the selection is wide:
sources.shortName: Which Shopping Malls To Visit In Ipoh

places.name: √ÜON Mall Ipoh Station 18

reviews.text: Ipoh's best shopping mall! A great mix of shops and F&B options, making it a perfect spot to shop and dine. The newly upgraded supermarket is a standout-spacious, well-organized, and easy to navigate with its wide aisles. Parking is ample on weekdays, but weekends can be a challenge as it fills up fast. A well-maintained and comfortable mall for all your shopping needs!

Posted 3rd Sept 2025
Medium size mall with quite a number of notable outlets.
The main outlet is Aeon supermarket. The mall is clean and well maintained. Parking is cashless. There is ample parking in the mall.

Came here for Manhattan Fish Market, but didn't eat there as it was near the foodcourt area and therefore had less privacy. In the end, we went to Mr Dakgalbi. Used to come here a looot when I was younger, but stopped when AEON Klebang started becoming popular. Am so surprised Me Dakgalbi is still around. The AEON market + AEON food court has absolutely transformed and become even better than Klebang's and Kinta City's. Soooo many varieties to choose for your breakfastlunchdinner. If you haven't experienced it, I absolutely recommend that you do. Looking forward to seeing their apparel section to complete renovations!

places.address: No.2, Susunan Stesen 18, Station 18, 31650 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia
